channel.title: Just registered
channel.description:
Sorry if you don't like threads like this, Don't hesitate to delete or lock if it isn't tolerated.
Well I just came across this community when I was talking to my friend and he mentioned private servers. He directed me to this forum. Although i'm not really into private servers I still joined. Because this community looks pretty cool. I guess ill say a bit about myself. I'm looking into learning Java or C++ whichever seems best. And this community looks like a good one to learn Java. I already do a lot of web design and stuff. I also play guitar and my musical interests include Thrash metal mainly. I hope I enjoy this community.

item.title: Just registered
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Dawn, post:10, topic:88685”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=129773.msg1258835#msg1258835 date=1178232963]

Sorry if you don’t like threads like this, Don’t hesitate to delete or lock if it isn’t tolerated.

Well I just came across this community when I was talking to my friend and he mentioned private servers. He directed me to this forum. Although i’m not really into private servers I still joined. Because this community looks pretty cool. I guess ill say a bit about myself. I’m looking into learning Java or C++ whichever seems best. And this community looks like a good one to learn Java. I already do a lot of web design and stuff. I also play guitar and my musical interests include Thrash metal mainly. I hope I enjoy this community.

First off, remember everything to do with private servers is at www.moparisthebest.com now

Secondly, welcome. In my opinion, if you haven’t learnt any programming languages before, go with a simple one. Visual Basics is always a good way to start. Maybe Ruby. Java can sometimes be a handful when starting programming. Also, buy a book Don’t do e-books (they are shit).
[/quote]
I have looked into both C++ more extensively though. I have tried out many other languages. I just tend to think these languages are something that if I learn them well. Its worth knowing them.[/quote]

Indeed they are, they can be quite useful. Besides, its a practical skill. As for choosing the language, its what you feel best going with. Java is easier to get into than C++ imho, and (if you do it properly) it teaches you object oriented structure from day 1. Also, there are a lot more people in this community familiar with java than C++. If you know C++, however, you can pick up any C-based language much more quickly.

Oh, and welcome to the forums

Read full topic

Well I just came across this community when I was talking to my friend and he mentioned private servers. He directed me to this forum. Although i’m not really into private servers I still joined. Because this community looks pretty cool. I guess ill say a bit about myself. I’m looking into learning Java or C++ whichever seems best. And this community looks like a good one to learn Java. I already do a lot of web design and stuff. I also play guitar and my musical interests include Thrash metal mainly. I hope I enjoy this community.
[/quote]

First off, remember everything to do with private servers is at www.moparisthebest.com now

Secondly, welcome. In my opinion, if you haven’t learnt any programming languages before, go with a simple one. Visual Basics is always a good way to start. Maybe Ruby. Java can sometimes be a handful when starting programming. Also, buy a book Don’t do e-books (they are shit).[/quote]
I have looked into both C++ more extensively though. I have tried out many other languages. I just tend to think these languages are something that if I learn them well. Its worth knowing them.
